channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly Tipping, 12th September
item.description:
Dumped stuff come out of 3 Hampstead Close I said you can’t just dump your rubbish her reply was I don’t care fine me. I am sick of reporting rubbish being dumped but today the resident at no. 3 was rude and didn’t care dumping her rubbish in broad day light this is a joke and needs something done .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hampstead Close, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown Willow trees, 12th September
item.description:
The willow trees as marked on the map are overgrown and is a serious danger to life and property. During windy conditions large tree branches separated from the willow trees are bashing against the nearby houses and parked vehicles, and can cause property damage. The willow tree pose a serious safety hazard to pedestrians and children on the road and in the park. During the past few years, damage caused by long roots of these willow trees can be observed on nearby properties and public infrastructure. Previous attempts to report these issues have not resulted in any response from the council. Kindly take urgent action to address these issues. I can provide additional photos and videos to support your investigation if needed. Thank you in advance for your prompt action.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crouch Croft, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light signal pedestrian crossing lamp post has been hit by a double deck bust damaging the light system. Misleading to pedestrians making them think it's green to cross but it's green for drivers. Green man and red man sign obscured by light which has been hit and damaged. Hazard and dangerous to pedestrians could cause death., 12th September
item.description:
Damaged broken pedestrian crossing light system

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eastway, Hackney, London
